title: SEBI directs Federal Agro Commercials to refund money collected from investors through preference shares
text: Follow @mldigital The company was engaged in fund mobilising activity through issuance of Preference Shares, to more than 49 persons, without complying with the relevant provisions of the Companies Act, 1956   SEBI passed an order on Federal Agro Commercials Limited and its directors by which they have been directed to refund the money collected by the company through issuance of Preference Shares, with interest at the rate of 15% per annum compounded at half yearly intervals and also not to access the capital market till the expiry of four years from the date of completion of refunds to investors.   According to the SEBI Order, the directors are also restrained from associating themselves with any listed public company and any public company which intends to raise money from the public, or any intermediary registered with SEBI.   The company was engaged in fund mobilising activity through issuance of Preference Shares, to more than 49 persons, without complying with the relevant provisions of the Companies Act, 1956.   To ensure the refunds reach all investors, SEBI has directed the company to advertise in the press detailing the modalities for refund, including details of contact persons including names, addresses and contact details, within fifteen days of the Order.   SEBI had passed an interim order on 1 December 2014 to stop collecting money from investors.
